title: Intentionally not ending the game
body:
I have noticed an increasing trend in games lately where players intentionally don't end the game solely to farm kills. I have played 4 games in the last 3 days in which I was on the receiving end of this. It hasn't happened on my end because I think it's about as douchey as you can get and I always just go end myself. 

I started thinking about it though and I recall seeing this several times on a few twitch streams. Not trying to dime anyone out but I've seen Bjergsen do it on several occasions and a few others as well and I can't help but think something along the lines of, "Us nubcakes are supposed to look up to guys like this?! Are you serious?" Lol, I also saw several challenger level players, including pros, that like to create a new team on smurfs and play their placements then just delete the team and do it again. That's good stuff RITO, keep paying these guys to play. 

i think possibly the best part of this game is that I can't even leave. I literally have to sit through as much as an hour of this because I'll get LeaveBustered if I just bail and do something else for a while. Oh and probably reported by the rest of my team. 

Has anyone else encountered this? Recently? The life of the game? I mean I suppose it's possible it's happened before and I just now noticed it because it has happened several times in rapid succession.

Edit: I try to surrender. A large portion of the LoL community is of the "Never give in, never surrender" mentality. 

I don't understand how some of you are trying to justify extending a game for upwards of 10 minutes because "it's fun" to waste someone's play time. Some people can only play for maybe an hour or one game a day and you're intentionally being a dick because "it's fun".

replies.body: When i see that i report for assisting enemy team, which is what they are doing. Why give the enemies time to scale and potentially come back?

I always report them for negative attitude because wasting 30 minutes of my life not being able to leave my base but not being able to leave the game either is enough to make me log out and not come back for a day or so. If LoL wasn't the largest online game in the world right now I think our overlords might even give a shit too. Alas, when you represent 24% of all online players you probably don't give a shit about one dudes experience.

The Surrender vote feature is there, its available. BUT if you DARE use it, You can be reported and eventually banned/chat restricted/etc. 
Its there, you can see it, you can use it. But If YOU DO use it, you -will- be punished. 

I have lost count how many times I have been told that "surrendering is for P**sies/Weaklings/noobs" (even if the score is 3-45 with No towers/inhibs or a naked nexus) or telling you how worthless you are for daring to admit You played your hardest, the other team just played better (at which point they will deny you were outplayed and that you are just a pathetic feeder)
"Report our Ashe, she voted to surrender and saved us 20 minutes on our lives! So rude and negative!"

Sad as it is, The team WOULD. Because apparently even if the score is 5-48, The team would rather turn a 20 minute match into a 68 minute match all because they are too proud to admit -they- could lose a match, that any match with THEM in it could end in a loss. So rather than concede defeat, they punish thier team by FORCING them to keep pushing as if they still had a chance. 

And then if thats not bad enough, when the match DOES end up in a loss and the whole rest of the team is like...2/17/3. players will find the one with the highest death and say "Its All thier fault. We would have won but "insert player" fed! Report the team, report >player<. My trash team!
...or you get 2 people that won't surrender and Riot doesn't know that 3 is a majority of 5 (who would have thought).

Yes, seen many posts about not surrendering.  Not every case is the same though.  Also, Riot requires 4/5 to surrender and that's just messed up to begin with.  Someday Riot will learn to count what a majority of 5 is.  Won't hold my breath.
nobody said everything had to be majority vote. even Congress uses a 2/3 vote to enact bills.

Ok, let's take a look at your example.  First of all, 2/3 is a majority.  Second: If there were 3 players and 2 voted to surrender, then that would qualify as a majority agreeing to surrender and should end the game.  The same as 3 people agreeing out of 5.

...what? by your logic, 4/5 is even more of a majority, so only a 4/5 vote should count. Again, nobody said everything had to be majority vote. If they want a higher standard, then they can implement a higher standard. 

Congress isnt made of 3 people - there are over 500 people who vote, and the Constitution requires a 2/3 vote to override a presidential veto. Nobody said 51% wins. Nobody said 60% wins. In Congress, you need a 66.6% vote to change anything. In League, you need 80%.

"by your logic, 4/5 is even more of a majority"
Very good.  4 is greater than 3 and both are a majority of 5.

"...so only a 4/5 vote should count. "
....and you failed.  I never said that anywhere and this is the problem with surrender in the game.

"Congress isnt made of 3 people"
How enlightening. *slow clap*  This game isn't congress and punishing the rest of the team for a minority not wanting to surrender isn't the way to go nor is it how it's done in RL.  By your logic, the minority should dictate surrender votes.

Unless youre absolutely delusional and think that people dont know 60% is greater than 50%. They **chose** not to allow that to surrender. They wanted a supermajority. They wanted 4/5. 

And i bring up Congress because even in a democracy, the majority doesnt always win. I dont know why you think 'majority' is some magical number than auto-wins every vote. It doesnt. Get used to it.
